text: , also lnown as , was a Japanese actor and playwright.Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "Zeami" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 1070-1071. ==Career== His career in Noh theater was supported by Ashikaga Yoshimitsu. After Yoshimitsu's death, the later Ashikaga shoguns were less supportive. ==Sado Island== In 1434, Zeami was exiled to Sado Island. He returned only a few years before his death. ==Selected works== In a summary based on writings by and about Zeami, OCLC/WorldCat lists roughly 1,700+ works in 4,400+ publications in 40+ languages and 56,600+ library holdings. WorldCat Identities: Zeami 1363-1443 ; retrieved 2012-6-8. : This list is not finished; you can help Wikipedia by adding to it. * Kadensho, 1420-1430 * Hagoromo * Shunkan * Takasago * Tadanori * Kinuta * Izutsu ==References== Category:1363 births Category:1443 deaths Category:Japanese writers Category:Playwrights Category:People from Aichi Prefecture
title: Zeami Motokiyo
